data.name: C/C++
content: C++ is a {{powerful programming language}} that I use extensively for {{high-performance computing}} and {{systems programming}}.
I've developed several projects in C++, including {{TensorGrad}}, a library for tensor operations with automatic gradient computation, and a {{2D game engine}} built from scratch.
C++ allows me to create {{efficient}} and {{optimized}} code for applications that require {{high performance}} and {{low-level control}}.
I particularly enjoy working with C++ for {{machine learning}} implementations and {{graphics programming}}, where performance is critical.

data.name: Python
content: Python is my {{go-to language}} for {{machine learning}}, {{data science}}, and {{rapid prototyping}}.
I've used Python extensively for developing {{AI applications}}, including {{computer vision systems}}, {{deep learning models}}, and {{natural language processing}} tools.
Some of my notable Python projects include {{Copilot-for-Linux}}, a document search system using word embeddings, and {{SHI}}, a deep fake detection system using computer vision techniques.
I appreciate Python's {{rich ecosystem}} of libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and OpenCV that enable me to quickly implement complex algorithms and models.

data.name: Machine Learning
content: Machine Learning is my {{primary area of expertise}} and {{passion}}. I've worked on various ML projects ranging from {{computer vision}} to {{natural language processing}}.
I have experience with both {{traditional ML algorithms}} and {{deep learning}} techniques, including neural networks, decision trees, and ensemble methods.
My projects like {{TensorGrad}} demonstrate my understanding of the mathematical foundations of machine learning, including {{automatic differentiation}} and {{gradient-based optimization}}.
I enjoy staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in the field and applying them to solve real-world problems.

data.name: Computer Vision
content: Computer Vision is one of my {{specialized areas}} within machine learning. I've implemented various CV algorithms and techniques in my projects.
My repository {{computer-vision}} contains implementations of fundamental algorithms like {{corner detection}}, {{edge detection}}, and {{feature extraction}}.
I've applied computer vision techniques in practical applications like {{SHI}}, a deep fake detection system that analyzes facial features and movements.
I'm familiar with libraries like {{OpenCV}} and frameworks like {{TensorFlow}} and {{PyTorch}} for implementing computer vision solutions.

data.name: Deep Learning
content: Deep Learning is a {{fascinating field}} that I've explored extensively through various projects and implementations.
I've worked with different neural network architectures including {{CNNs}}, {{RNNs}}, and {{Transformers}} for tasks ranging from image recognition to sequence generation.
My project {{Piano-Roll-Generation}} uses transformer models to generate music, demonstrating my ability to apply deep learning to creative domains.
I've implemented deep learning models from scratch in my {{TensorGrad}} library, giving me a deep understanding of the underlying mathematics and algorithms.

data.name: Git
content: Git is an {{essential tool}} in my development workflow for {{version control}} and {{collaboration}}.
I use Git for all my projects, maintaining clean commit histories and organizing my work through branches and pull requests.
I'm comfortable with advanced Git operations like rebasing, merging, and resolving conflicts.
Git helps me maintain code quality and track changes effectively across all my projects.
In my daily programming routine, I integrate Git through practices like {{feature branch workflows}}, {{commit-then-push cycles}}, and {{continuous integration}}.

My typical Git workflow includes: creating focused branches for features, making atomic commits with descriptive messages, regularly pushing to remote repositories, and using pull requests for code review.
I've set up {{Git hooks}} to automate tasks like linting and testing before commits, ensuring code quality throughout the development process.
For collaborative projects, I leverage Git's features for {{merge conflict resolution}}, {{code reviews}} via pull requests, and {{release management}} using tags and semantic versioning.

data.name: Linux
content: Linux is my {{preferred operating system}} for development and daily use.
I'm comfortable with the Linux command line and use it extensively for tasks ranging from system administration to development.
My project {{Copilot-for-Linux}} demonstrates my ability to develop tools specifically for the Linux environment.
I appreciate the flexibility and power that Linux provides for development and experimentation.
In my programming routine, I leverage Linux's powerful {{shell scripting}} capabilities to automate repetitive tasks and streamline my workflow.
I use tools like {{tmux}} for terminal multiplexing, allowing me to manage multiple coding sessions and processes simultaneously.
My development environment includes customized {{Vim/Neovim}} configurations for efficient text editing, along with {{Bash aliases}} and {{custom scripts}} to increase productivity.
I utilize Linux's package management systems to maintain up-to-date development tools and libraries, and take advantage of {{containerization}} with Docker for consistent development environments.

data.name: AI Assisted Programming
content: AI Assisted Programming is a {{modern approach}} to software development that I've embraced to enhance my productivity.
I use tools like GitHub Copilot to accelerate development while maintaining a critical understanding of the code being generated.
I believe in combining AI assistance with strong fundamentals in computer science and software engineering.
This approach allows me to focus on higher-level design and problem-solving while automating more routine coding tasks.
In my daily programming routine, I integrate AI tools like {{GitHub Copilot}} and {{Cursor}} to boost productivity while maintaining code quality and understanding.
My workflow includes using AI for {{code completion}}, {{documentation generation}}, and {{refactoring suggestions}} while critically reviewing all AI-generated code.
I've developed a balanced approach where I leverage AI for {{boilerplate code}} and {{common patterns}}, while manually implementing critical algorithms and business logic.

For complex projects, I use AI assistants to help with {{API exploration}}, {{debugging suggestions}}, and {{test case generation}}, which significantly speeds up development cycles while ensuring robust code.
